comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: From the NYT, query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9907EFD7123CE633A... FORTY NATIONS IN COMMERCE CONGRESS; Session Opens in Boston on Oct. 24, After Which Delegates Will Tour the Country. September 16, 1912, Monday Representatives of forty nations, some of whom will arrive at this port to-morrow, and the others during the week, will attend the fifth International Congress of Chambers of Commerce and Industrial Associations in Boston Oct. 24 to 26, inclusive, which will be the most important meeting of its kind in the history of the commercial world. ... Among the delegates arriving tomorrow will be three who played a leading part on the Chinese revolution. They are Dr. Chen Chin-tao, a Yale graduate who served as Minister of Finance at Nanking; Dr C. C. Wang, also of Yale and the University of Illinois, who recently was appointed Director of the Mukden Railway, and Dr, Fu Liang.
